website_summaries.verdict: A powerful workhorse that combines a sleek design with 20V of power and long battery life to deliver performance the competition can't beat.
pros: Powerful brushless motor provides longer run time than others in its class
Rugged, yet fairly lightweight and easy to handle
LED spotlight makes working in low light easier
cons: Somewhat pricey, and battery must be bought separately
Some owners gripe about loose-fitting batteries

customer_reviews.title: Weird, brand new tool doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work after using it maybe 5 times. It’s practically brand new and doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: S. Metzler

customer_reviews.title: not too happy about. DeWalt needs to step it up
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to order my third one in a year I'm electrician in Florida and do a lot of concrete work... I use this tool on a daily basis when I called about a warranty they want me to drop it off over an hour and a half away at a service center to see if it's covered... I don't have time for that.. not too happy about . DeWalt needs to step it up..
customer_reviews.author: Stacy R.

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt products are great except this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have several dewalt products that I am more than satisfied with including 3 other drills. This one quit after minimal use over the course of 2 months. I sent it back about a month ago to a dewalt repair center and I am still waiting for a refund (didn't want the replacement). I have called them twice and they can't confirm they have it even though the tracking number shows it was delivered. I might look for another brand for future tools after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Has Dewalt gone down
customer_reviews.text: I used this once to drill a hole in my wall with the hammerdrill function. It started doing the classic Dewalt intermittent dance. The second time that I tried to use it... It would work until the trigger was pulled a second time... Then nothing. One good thing... It showed it's true colors early... at least i can get my money back. I am wondering what brand of drill is good now... Anyone have any idea? I had a Dewalt 12 volt for many, many years, and had no problem with it at all, just couldn't get batteries for it anymore... Oh well, too bad... Once a good company.
customer_reviews.author: G. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Motor has almost no power. Will turn chuck with no-load. When load put on drill, even set a lowest slip level of 1, motor stalls. Tried three different known good Dewalt 20v batteries. Same problem, motor has almost no power. Tried switching from Speed from 3 down to 1 with gear reduction. Did not help.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Drill failed after using for only a few hours
customer_reviews.text: Normally have had good luck with Dewalt drills, have an older one (1998) the still works, just don't want buy the older style batteries. This one worked out of the box, but after using for a few hours, just on vehicle trim screws, not heavy duty drilling or hammering, just stopped working. Makes a little noise when pressing trigger, and LED worklight comes on, but motor doesn't turn. Haven't had a brushless design before, not sure if they hold up as well, but guessing this one was just defective. No issues with seller, returned for credit (didn't offer to send replacement).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Henning

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IF YOU NEED IT FOR WORK.  IT WILL LET YOU DOWN.
customer_reviews.text: Just quit working after 8 days. Never drilled larger than 3/4" holes. DeWalt used to be the best name in cordless. But their quality control is now garbage. This isn't the first time I've gotten a DeWalt recently that quit working way too soon. Went through warranty with those, but that's a huge hassle. (Currently have the one in repair, it's been weeks haven't heard anything.). I guess I'll switch to Milwaukee. Which sucks because I have a bunch of DeWalt batteries. But I'm sick of the low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this. I bought it primarily to anchor a power rack to my basement floor. I was using a 5/16' bit, and honestly, this thing sucked. I ended up borrowing a Hilti from a buddy down the road, and knocked it out in 15 minutes after struggling with the Dewalt for a LOT longer than that. I just did a side by side comparison with my Dewalt drill and this unit with a smaller bit in my poured wall.. The drill did just fine, enough that this unit is now in the box and going back. The appearance was nice, the LED light was nice, but I couldn't justify keeping it for how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: I've had 2 break within 1 month period
customer_reviews.text: This is the second same model drill I have had break. The gears inside the drill explode while using it. The process to get the drill repaired through the manufacturer is a very frustrating experience and costs (even though under warranty) half the amount of a new drill AND takes a minimum of two weeks. Total bummer. I have always loved Dewalt tools and have used them for 20+ years. This tool is not the quality I've grown to expect from Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jr

customer_reviews.title: Rotary Hammer Setting Works Good
customer_reviews.text: Very much like a drill/driver, but has a rotary hammer setting. It drilled a dozen 3" deep holes in cement just fine. I ended up adding 5 holes one by one as I placed items, so I'm glad I bought it rather than rented it. 4.0 amp hour battery works way better than 2.0 amp hour battery. I don't see any reason you couldn't use this as your daily drill/driver.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Nardi

customer_reviews.title: It’s last 1 1/2months.
customer_reviews.text: I am a plumber and this drill does after 1 1/2months. The one befor this one last 3 months. That’s two brand new dewalt dcd996b drills in under 6 months. Rest of the crew has Milwaukee and have zero issues. Dewalt has gone downhill bigtime
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Regan

customer_reviews.title: This drill is JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drill for 8 months. It's been lightly used until now. I just used the hammer option and the drill broke. The 1st 6 inch hole was ok, but the drill got pretty hot. After cooling it down, I tried a 2nd hole. It overheated within an inch and stopped working. Now the motor chatters around and there's functionality to it. This drill is JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cory G.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in a long time trusted brand... let down TWICE
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with my drill. This is the second one I got because the first broke. I spent extra for a better one I use all Dewalt products. This will be no longer the case. The first drill literally fell apart. Tiny bolts dropped out as I was drilling and smoke came out. This one made clattering sounds and is now breaking. I put a lot of money into my Dewalt tools and I told people they should get them. I’m going to switch now and now I have to tell my friends I was wrong and why. They will loose trust in my word.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Turns Concrete Into Butter
customer_reviews.text: I have not been a fan of cordless hammer drills until now. I often have to drill through or into concrete at wife's business and have used the corded Dewalt and that has worked awesome. I have to get up on a ladder about 15-18 feet to drill on occasion so I got tired of running long extension wires...so I wanted to try this drill. I was very impressed with it, drilled 1.5 inches into concreted in about 15 seconds with hardly any effort, like the corded Dewalt. It was so much more convenient without the cord and the holster I got with it is great when on the ladder. Great drill and am very glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Big T.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I bought this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Dewalt battery powered impact gun and impact driver and now I finally have the matching drill. I bought a cheap black and decker drill 5 years ago and while it never gave me any problems I never realized what I was missing. Just lossening some drywall screws was so much faster with this one. Dewalt is a great brand and I really enjoy this drill. I wish I bought it a long time ago. As I'm doing some remodeling in my house this will come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: paulicious21

customer_reviews.title: The best you can get!
customer_reviews.text: This the best drill I've ever used. It has so much power it could brake your wrist if you aren't careful. I just used it today for the first time as a hammer drill and it drilled 1/2" holes in cinder blocks like they were pine! I used this throughout a long kitchen remodel and it was very good. I had to drill a 6" hole through 1" particle boards and it was nothing to this beast. I would say this can do anything my Milwaukee Magnum Holeshooter could do and then some. It also runs for a long time on my 1 1/2 amphr battery pack the brushless motor is very good both for battery conservation and power delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Kibbler

customer_reviews.title: Best drill with the worst directional switch
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine, but forward / reverse switch was very loose. A very light brush would flip it. Brought it to a dewalt licensed dealer to be repaired. 2 weeks later got it back. Better, but not good. Doesnt positively snap into gear like every other Dewalt tool I own. Lots of reviews stating this. Seems to be a problem with Dewalt on this particular drill. Seeing as this is the best drill dewalt offers, youd think they would address this....
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Diminished quality. Improved LED, battery and motor.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a DeWalt fan for years. It was time to upgrade my trusty 18v xrp that lasted years before switch failure. I would say DeWalt quality has diminished over the years. The chuck has a tendency to loosen and your expensive and brittle carbide bit drops on the ground. The speed selection switch sticks and does not operate smoothly. LED is improved. Good trigger control over speed. Good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, but a bit on the high side for price
customer_reviews.text: This tool was used extensively during the construction of our 30'x40'x16' steel building. It held up good even though it got a bit hot at times (temps outside reach 100+ too.) It does have a tendency to cut out during use. It will basically hiccup the power and then keep going. It didn't hinder the job, but you can tell it cuts out occasionally. The chuck performed admirably. It never slipped a bit even while drilling several metal siding sheets (26g PBR panels,) cold formed and hot rolled steel as well as 1/4" plates.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID E CHRISTENSEN

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my old electric screw driver and old corded drill for this. I have drilled through concrete, wood and tile. Hammer function works well and a lot less arm / wrist vibration than the corded drill. I have all 60v flex volt tools now. Chain saw, blower, trimmer etc. I have used both the 20v and the 60v flex batteries with the drill and they both work great. It is a bit heavy up a ladder with the 60v flex volt battery attached, but to drill through concrete it was nice to have the battery weight to help. Very controllable speed and depth. Happy buyer here.
customer_reviews.author: DMAC

customer_reviews.title: Worse
customer_reviews.text: Worse worse worse First if all I bought and it didnt come with batteries now I order batteries and they here and the drill not working...kmt
customer_reviews.author: Shanaz

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week
customer_reviews.text: the motor made some weird noise when trying to drill a simple little hole and then somehting snapped or broke off inside because you can here it shaking around in there. Drill wont turn on now. I bought this drill to replace the exact same model I had for years. Loved this model from dewalt but this drill from amazon couldnt even make a hole.
customer_reviews.author: Lisset

customer_reviews.title: What a Huge Difference!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from the old 18v models (from like 10 years ago), and boy, what a difference! Even without the hammer function turned on, this thing just powers through drilling projects, but it's still fast when you put it up against masonry. And obviously, the FlexVolt system of batteries makes battery life a non-issue. Slap one of those 5Ah batteries on there and it'll last you all day, or several days if you're not doing long work days. Easy-change torque and speed settings.
customer_reviews.author: Rhydon Johansen

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer drill, as far as a 20v drill goes. I was using it one time for repeated drilling of 1/2 inch holes 5 inches deep, in concrete with a need to finish quickly. On the 8th hole the motor felt warm, made a beep, and shut down. It never restarted but DeWalt replaced the tool in short order with a brand new one, and no questions asked. I still use this drill daily but am cautious. I have recently purchased a DeWalt hammer drill that is intended for heavy lifting like this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great drill!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this drill. I am in the construction field and have used a number of the other Dewalt drills and I have burnt out all the motors on them. I tried the brushless motor and have not had any issues. I use the drill to drill through wood, metal and shallow concrete. I use standard size bits as well as long 4' flex bits and 18" drill bits and haven't had any issues. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good drill
customer_reviews.author: Geiger23

customer_reviews.title: My best drill yet!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded and added this to my toolset. I always wanted 2 drills... I hate changing bits and drivers in the middle of a job... I still have my Dewalt 14.4 hammer drill and I put the 2 drills to work rebuilding parts of my fence. What a joy not to switch out the bits and drivers! This 20v hammer drill is awesome, in hammer mode the longer screws drove right in with no effort. This drill is a beast! My 14.4 Dewalt drill is over 13 years old, I expect nothing less from my Dewalt 20v hammer drill.
customer_reviews.author: A. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very good drill
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power. I drilled several 1.5" diameter holes with a self feeding bit with no problem. You definitely need to use the second handle to keep from hurting yourself at full power (learned that the hard way). It's also pretty good for sensitive jobs. The only drawback being that in order to get to the lowest power, you need to set the speed to 3 which spins it a little faster than I would like. The hammer function works fine. I've had a lot of cordless drills over the years and, if it can stand the test of time, this one would be the best yet. Definitely a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for not even two months
customer_reviews.text: Bought Jan 22 of 2020.. it has already stopped working twice and it's only Aug. They repaired it in Feb and now the repair process is even more ridiculous. The customer service is terrible on DeWalt also!!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi J Warpness

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware. This drill doesn’t come with a battery or charger. You have to buy separate. Ordered this not realizing it didn’t come with anything to actually have it work. What a waster of 129 dollars. Returned
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after one attempt at using the hammer drill to drill into cinder block
customer_reviews.author: sNoProblem

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since i'm already in the DeWalt platform and needed a hammer drill for some work i was doing. I was actually pretty amazed at how well the hammer drill worked and the drill itself is quite powerful. I would recommend this to anyone needing a drill/hammer drill.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Sa

customer_reviews.title: Higher quality drill
customer_reviews.text: Update : I'm totally satisfied, it's power is awesome. Battery lasts longer, I have made 30 masonry holes and 20 wood holes and then drill 3 inches screw into each with only initial charge of battery DeWalt dcb205ck 20 V Max 5.0 Ah I can't write a complete review because battery not jet arrived, but it looks so strong and very comfortable. When bateries arrived I will update my review. I'm so happy with this drill
customer_reviews.author: Andres Castro

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I use this drill in hammer mode to drill 3/4" holes 16" deep in tree stumps with a spade bit. Does the job, drilling about 10 holes on one battery charge. I also made it drill 5/8" holes 12" deep in a huge boulder to split with wedges & feathers, but that's a lot to ask for a cordless drill. It's just about exactly what I needed but my old DeWalt hammer drill works better for a screw gun.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Safety and Power
customer_reviews.text: This is a definitely a new model, I owned the last model 5 years ago and it put in major work. What I like most is the safety system, I think designed to stop a locked motor. The best!
customer_reviews.author: Juan J. Flores-Loza

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Battery fits very loose and drill oscillated like crazy. Not the dewalt quality i am used to.
customer_reviews.author: Gerhard Esterhuizen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Lasted 6 months of very little use. Very disappointed. Battery is fine because I have other Dewalt tools that work. This power drill just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like Dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.text: I have several Dewalt tools, but I bought this 1/2" brushless Dewalt Hammer Drill for a specific use with my ice fishing auger. I paired it with the 8" Strikemaster Lite Flite Lazer Auger and it they both work great together. It was a perfect pairing and the setup is so light and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast! I usually upgrade every ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! I usually upgrade every few years when I wear them out from drilling holes roughing out houses for electrical. I try to stick with one brand for major tools cause having too many different batteries is a pain to charge. I always buy dewalt since I have a few problems with Milwaukee tools, they either stop working or smoke to death. I'll just stick to something I can trust more then the other.
customer_reviews.author: JAV

customer_reviews.title: Job Detail Security
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this drill about two weeks ago, and there is serious power coming from this drill... Drills through poured concrete like butter and the drill surprisingly does not become too hot to brace at times as like my other drill... Warning though,,, wear ear plugs if you use this drill often,,, the high pitch of the bit tearing through the concrete IS deafening...
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Autumn Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very torque-y. Plenty of umpfh to get through about anything.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Guarenteed to do it's best to break your arm if the bit binds. Perfect for drilling holes in 6" posts in my shop for running wiring. Strong enough for anything I've thrown at it so far.
customer_reviews.author: James Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure i got a broken one or its a chinese knockoff.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure mine arrived broken, but doesnt look that way - but it refuses to put enough torque to keep going even on full blast when i am simply holding it with my hand. I could be wrong - please correct me if so, but my other dewalt drills have blasted free of my grip with no problem .
customer_reviews.author: Hobineros

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill; ample power, not too heavy and easy to use. My only issue is the power selector is a bit finicky and it is easy to skip the #2 setting. I drilled 20 holes in masonry each over 1.5" deep and installed over 30 screws with 2/3 battery power remaining.
customer_reviews.author: O. K. Maharaj

customer_reviews.title: lasted less then a month
customer_reviews.text: electrical contractor, putting up fans, lights, some tap cons...I have switched to Milwaukee because these drills don't last at all anymore...to be honest nothing of dewalt is lasting...hammer drills, impact drills, sawsalls and multi tools as well...have had three multi tools quit in last 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Jason Weatherly

customer_reviews.title: the chuck is not easily replaceable. I am not a builder
customer_reviews.text: After 18 months, the chuck locked up. Unlike many drills, the chuck is not easily replaceable. I am not a builder, just a homeowner that does some DIY. I expected a lot more from Dewalt! This was my second drill from them the first only lasted 2 years. I will be trying other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: First one they sent me was used and beat to crap, so they replaced it
customer_reviews.text: The drill rips, and the LED is nicer than any other drill I've had before, but have had constant issues from the ones I've purchased off amazon. First one they sent me was used and beat to crap, so they replaced it, no problem. Next one they sent me appeared to be better, but after about a month of use I'm having some issues with the chuck. Went I got to tighten/loosen it, it gives out on me and the motor spins. Never seen that before. Idk if it's too late to return this one but its still in like new condition and I don't give it another month.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Tovar

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This really cuts through cement
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to make pilot holes for the blue screws that are to anchor things into cement. This thing drilled the holes really fast. I went down through 2-3 inches of cement. It was like drilling into wood!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: This Drill/Hammer gun work great. I love that you can click on it ...
customer_reviews.text: This Drill/Hammer gun work great. I love that you can click on it to switch from drill to hammer depending on what you are using it for. Very powerful, matter of fact you better put the handle on it if you are going into something that might stick because it will try to jerk it out of your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: A beast!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a "free add-on" during a special, and wow...once you learn how to use it, it's a beast! It came with a handle attachment and you will need it to offset the torque this thing can generate. I got a 23" wood bit and an 18" masonry bit for it, and it will run them through material without a hiccup. It has become my go-to drill.
customer_reviews.author: OdylicMaven

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill for big jobs. I have only 6aH batteries so it lasts forever but is HEAVY. For lighter duty, or for ladder work, a small battery pack would probably be best. It has enough power to auger through 10" pine logs at my log home.
customer_reviews.author: Rbimd

customer_reviews.title: good light-duty hammerdrill
customer_reviews.text: I like that it can operate as a normal drill or a hammer drill. The hammer isn't super strong and will be excellent for lighter jobs. outside of that, it fit with my other DeWalt items and i didn't have to buy another battery!
customer_reviews.author: Pop ina Bottle

customer_reviews.title: Best drill I've every encountered
customer_reviews.text: Beast, also cut is awesome for switching from heavy jobs to light and gives me a confident consistent torque. Light is great and the collar on the chuck really helps out when you have weird little jobs to do, ratcheting chuck with carbide inserts save me from dropping extensions off of 80 ft roof unlike my partners ryobi.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely DeWalt, drills anyway
customer_reviews.text: Great drill, 3 speeds, best torque in class. Long life, just replaced one have had for years, old one still works but Chuck getting touchy so it's now a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D

customer_reviews.title: The best drill you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Using many different hand tools in my day to day work- thee most comfortable hand held tool for sure. Variable speed from trigger is well distributed through trigger pull. All around the best drill I’ve ever used- use for drilling various metals and plastics, whole saws up to 3” in stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: JustSaying

customer_reviews.title: The drill is great.
customer_reviews.text: Used one just like it at work and like it so much had to get one for myself. Drill is great. The drill did arrive all package up in orginal box but the drill had a large scrape on it. It looked new and work great.
customer_reviews.author: CSK

customer_reviews.title: Number one name and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a lighter version of this and it really just was not up to what I demanded. With the hammer option, it truly gets the job done! If you really must work a tool hard and fast, this is the option you need!
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: 100% worth every Penny!!! Don’t wait!!! (I’m not a sales person) lol
customer_reviews.text: This drill will make you wonder how in the world did you ever use another. Not only is the battery life incredible, not only is it 10x stronger than other drills, this drill looks awesome! I love the 3 speed, and the overall use of this drill. If I was to give one complaint, I’d say the hammer drill is overly powerful, it drills holes in brick way to easy and makes other drills look weak, it’s not a very humble drill. ;) All jokes aside, this drill is worth the money and I’d 100% buy another if needed. This is coming from someone who uses this drill on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Brown

customer_reviews.title: A must have when upgrading from corded to cordless
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and functionality is beyond superior in my opinion. Whether your looking to upgrade or this is your first purchase. You can be very well confident that you are taking care of.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Mendiola

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this very strong drill!
customer_reviews.text: Love the drill. Used it mostly to drill into concrete and stone for small ancors. Very powerful drill. I've always had good luck with Dewalt tools. They have just been good to me and made me lots of money. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Bishop Reigns

customer_reviews.title: Problem in less than 2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: With less than 2 months mine stopped working without explanation. It was drilling a 2x4 with the drill and it stopped! Only with 2x4 !!! I recharged the battery again, tested it in several possible ways and it doesn't work anymore !! I contacted Amazon, but my return period had passed 5 days ... Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Defective clutch
customer_reviews.text: Sent first drill back for exchange. the second drill had the same problem clutch would not engage until set to 8 and then it would lock in with no slip. sent the second one back for refund Do not like leaving negative reviews but this is not what I expect from a dewalt tool. I use them every day for work and these are not the quality I'm used to
customer_reviews.author: That guy from puyallup

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill
customer_reviews.text: Nice Strong drill. It's great having the ability to use a hammer drill when needed. Also the clutch is nice. It just stops when you reach the desired torque. It is a bit heavy but I understood it probably would be for the performance. If you use a drill a lot it may not be right for you, but I use my 20v impact most of the time unless I'm actually drilling something.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Look great, Light weight but Stopped working way to fast
customer_reviews.text: For the size of the hammer drill it’s actually pretty light to carry compared to other brands. How ever on the day I was planning on purchasing a second one the drill stopped working!! Light won’t illuminate it doesn’t turn doesn’t make a noise I change the battery and nothing it’s like it lost all kinds of power it doesn’t make any kind of attempt to work very disappointed I purchased it a little over a month and used it approximately 10 times drilling 1/2 holes through 3/4 plywood. Never even used the hammer drill option!
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Deharo

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade over other dewalt "hammer drills"
customer_reviews.text: The key difference is drills that have a legit hammer drill setting. You'll know if you have it, the difference between the normal max number setting and hammer drill is huge. Great for construction.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: The Dewalt 3 speed 20v XR is a great tool to have. I had the 2 speed and there is a huge difference. If you are looking to get a Dewalt drill, make sure you get the 3 speed XR, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam II

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt
customer_reviews.text: One of the strongest, for an 18V hammer drill. Works like a champ, percussions are a bit loud and whiney, but otherwise is great for getting small jobs done (anchoring, concrete drilling, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of my Bosch when I moved and of course needed a hammer drill to install new thresholds in the concrete. This had no problem drilling hole after hold in multiple locations. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: M. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: The drill is well done. Having a built-in light can't be overestimated. This feature alone makes the tool worth it. Be careful holding the drill especially with larger diameter bit, the electric motor is powerful and will spin your hand if your grip is weak. Secure down your drilled piece.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Second and Third bad speeds
customer_reviews.text: Second and third speed went bad after the second time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey

customer_reviews.title: Great power for the size
customer_reviews.text: Good drill, had previously bought the atomic DeWalt and was disappointed. Then got this as a replacement for that and this one is a beast. Drills through 1/2 porcelain tile with ease. As well as concrete. The spot light feature is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great size & power for most home projects

customer_reviews.title: New hammer drill.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer Drill

customer_reviews.title: Not happy

customer_reviews.author: Gerritt

customer_reviews.title: It spins up to speed on a fast curve so ...

customer_reviews.author: Jarhead Dan

customer_reviews.title: Quit after 3 weeks with no abuse

customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Really like this drill
customer_reviews.text: This is the drill to get if you only want to buy one. Eats through masonry, can run in screws using an appropriate clutch setting, dril mode is very strong so it easily drills large holes in wood (2" plus), solid, strong, steel chuck.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic customer experience!
customer_reviews.text: The drill is strong and solid, exactly what I expected. I am very happy with all my Dewalt purchases. I'm writing this review more for the great customer service experience. An unclear listing in a linked page almost cost me $160 that I wasn't prepared to spend. But Danny from the customer service chat line cleared it up and proved that Amazon's staff is looking out for its customers. Thanks for a great exchange!
customer_reviews.author: RGMax

customer_reviews.title: Will not let me return it. Bad product from the get go.

customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: Serious, power
customer_reviews.text: I've looked at other brands of cordless tools and many are so light weight, they seem like disposables. This, on the other hand, is one serious, powerful drill. My only caution is that if you're just doing light jobs around the house, you probably don't need this much power.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Still Going!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Drill. Use it 5 days a week and the battery last at least 4 weeks. The light to view where you are drilling is bright. I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill

customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.

customer_reviews.author: Bruce Graham

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how fast it drills 1/2" holes in 2x4's
customer_reviews.text: Absolute beast of a drill! It's amazing how fast it drills 1/2" holes in 2x4's. I haven't tried it as a hammer drill yet, but as a normal drill it works great. Has tons of torque.

customer_reviews.title: A must buy.
customer_reviews.text: BUY THIS! This hammer drill is awesome, powerful, and light! I drilled 8 holes for shelving in 5 minutes, my corded drill takes so much more using the same drill bit. The chuckless system is great on its own making changing bits east and fast. I highly recommend this hammer drill.

For drilling lots of large holes in concrete you probably should step up to an SDS drill. I bought the bare tool but if you with a 5 ah or 6 ah battery a lot of work can be done before the battery need changing.

customer_reviews.title: Brand new
customer_reviews.text: A real spearhead in the range of similar products; together with a good battery you finish everything well, regardless of its level of difficulty. It's really powerful.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill

customer_reviews.text: Great product, great quality. New and improved, better ergonomics, better light, the light floods the area like a flashlight and has a timer adjustable for working in dark locations.

customer_reviews.title: Love this drill
customer_reviews.text: If all the Dewalt drills I’ve owned this far exceeds them all. Love this drill. Brushless motor provides awesome power so hold on! Just bought their compact brushless sawzall after seeing the power of the drill. It’s just as great.

customer_reviews.text: I got good stuff. Power is good and I like it because it is expected too. If you're a man, you need to know how to use the tool. The tool is DEWALT
customer_reviews.author: Jaeho Lee

customer_reviews.title: Monster Drill
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute monster. I recommend hearing protection while drilling into concrete on the hammer setting. But, it’s good to have this much power if/when you ever need it. I would buy it again, without a doubt.

customer_reviews.title: More power than I expected
customer_reviews.text: For the size and weight of this drill, it has incredible power. It's easy to handle and runs all day on one 5 ah battery. This is exactly what I needed for the jobs I do.

customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. So smooth and powerful. I have been buying a lot of the 20 volt Max tools and they are all great tools. I have the 5ah batteries and they last forever.
